description: Defines how the player is addressed and reflected in the world. This schema intentionally avoids fixed identity, backstory, demographics, or narrative trajectory.

address.description: Optional fields that control how the player is addressed in text. These fields affect presentation only and carry no narrative meaning.

display_name.description: Optional name or nickname used in rare, low-pressure address. If unset, the game defaults to second-person ("you").

pronouns.description: Preferred pronouns for third-person references. If unset or unspecified, the game defaults to second-person or neutral constructions.

premise.description: Internal representation of the player's descriptive state. Premise values influence tone selection only and never imply direction, diagnosis, or completion.

facets.description: Weighted facet map (facet_id -> weight). Facets describe conditions of play, not outcomes.

last_bias_update.description: Timestamp of the last premise bias adjustment (for debugging only).

state.description: Mechanical state unrelated to identity or self-definition.

inventory.description: Derived list for display only; canonical counts live in inventory_counts.

relationships.description: Affinity values with NPCs. These reflect familiarity, not approval or improvement.

journaling_enabled.description: Controls whether reflective text is recorded. Journal entries are observational, not confessional.
